CSSScale.summary: The CSSScale interface of the CSS Typed Object Model API represents the scale() and scale3d() values of the individual {{CSSXRef('transform')}} property in CSS. It inherits properties and methods from its parent .

CSSScaleCSSScale.summary:
The CSSScale() constructor creates a new
object representing the scale() and scale3d() values of the
individual 'transform' property in CSS.

CSSScaleX.summary:
The x property of the
interface gets and sets the abscissa or x-axis of the
translating vector.
CSSScaleX.value: A . Can be set to a number, which is wrapped in a of unit: "number".

CSSScaleY.summary:
The y property of the
interface gets and sets the ordinate or y-axis of the
translating vector.
CSSScaleY.value: A . Can be set to a number, which is wrapped in a of unit: "number".

CSSScaleZ.summary:
The z property of the
interface representing the z-component of the translating
vector. A positive value moves the element towards the viewer, and a negative value
farther away.

remarks.para:
If this value is present then the transform is a 3D transform and the is2D
property will be set to false.

CSSScaleZ.value: A . Can be set to a number, which is wrapped in a of unit: "number".
